title: Can Joe Biden win in a landslide in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sort of. But this depends on how you define “landslide.” There used to electoral college landslides where the losing candidate got only one or two or three states. This is no longer possible because of the extreme partisan polarization over the past 40 years. That said, if Biden were to win all the states where he is currently ahead in the polls — even if only by about 1 percent — he’d win 406 electoral votes. Trump would be reduced to only 20 states. That would be as close to a landslide as is currently possible. This would mean Biden would take Arizona, Florida, Georgia, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Michigan and Wisconsin. Maybe even Iowa. But that may not be a likely scenario. For one thing, Biden’s polling advantage is only around 1 to 3 pts in some of those states — and that’s within the margin of error of the polls. Moreover, after Labor Day, that’s when the campaigns get really in high gear. The Trump team has a vast cash horde and after Labor Day they are going to unleash an avalanche of mud against Biden and the Democrats. Thus it’s likely the polls will tighten up in the last months before the election. Even so, Trump’s approval rating recently crashed to 36 percent with a disapproval rating at 60 percent. He is the most hated president in the history of polling. And he’s doing nothing to turn that around. The country is going through a huge series of crises — the coronavirus epidemic has killed 140,000 people, the real unemployment rate is 18 percent and we’re on verge of a possible great depression scenario, and most of the pubic disagrees with Trump on “race relations” and his response to the protests in the wake of the murder of George Floyd. And Trump is just doubling down in the wrong direction on all these issues — trying to pretend the coronavirus will go away, pushing reopening of schools and other facilities in a push that would be likely to kill people — 62 percent say opening schools for in person classes this fall would not be safe. I don’t really see anything likely to turn around Trump’s rapidly sliding fortunes. He knows he’s losing. And all he can do is engage in fascist style attacks on protestors, yammer conspiracy theories about “antifa”, continue to try to hide the extent of the coronavirus epidemic, and on and on. Trump is cruisin’ for a bruisin’. But it’s not at all clear just how much Biden will win by. Nor are the Democrats resting on their laurels. They are also very nervous about this and do NOT believe they have this in the bag.

No. It may be possible that he could win the general election if the Democrats unite behind him, but a “landslide” is unlikely and for a few reasons. Reason One: The country is too partisan and too polarized to allow for it: Regardless of how it started or who started, it the country is far more polarized today than it was a generation ago. This means it will be difficult to have “compromises” were both sides give up something to get something bigger. Everyone wants everything and all the credit for it if it’s good. This means there is going to be little room for a Republican to back down and vote Democrat or for a Democrat to back down and vote for Trump. Which means it will be hard for any Democrat, even Biden to win in the Midwest and the South. Just as it will be hard for Trump to do well in New York or California. In this, Biden could win if the Democrats unite behind him, should he win the nomination, but it’s doubtful he’s going to overcome the partisanship, which will then narrow the election considerably. Reason Two: The Democrats are too fractious within themselves: And the divisions in the country as a whole are nothing when compared to the divisions within the Democratic Party. Getting Democratic voters to unite behind the Democratic nominee is going to be like herding cats. The voters won’t blindly vote Democrat if they don’t like the nominee. And this is actually something that will likely COST Biden the general election. For the Democratic Party base has already declared they will fight him if he is elected, and given that were only at the start of the primary campaigns says something about that. So, while Biden may win some swing voters, the Democratic base will likely go home and cry that their particular progressive didn’t win the nomination and think that by not voting that progressive will be named President out of sympathy… and will then cry harder when they learn they get President Trump for another four years. Reason Three: Things are relatively stable economically: While Trump’s policies haven’t been the miracle recovery he claims them to be… they aren’t exactly the burning trash heap that they’ve been attacked as either. There may be certain areas where things aren’t going great, but so long as he can present positive numbers in job or wage growth… Trump will be able to present a reason to re-elect him that WILL be attractive to a fair number of voters and will make Biden’s job tougher. Because he would then be having to present a way to either present an idea that would do better than what Trump will claim or present a believable argument on where Trump’s policies have failed. For so long as Trump can claim success… it will be hard to get people to switch their votes if they feel comfortable with what they have. What does this mean? It means the election will be narrow, regardless of who wins. People may want a landslide victory for their candidate but in today’s political atmosphere… that’s not likely. And thinking it will happen is pure fantasy. Biden could win, but it won’t be that much… and Trump may win again, but it won’t be by that much… Biden’s Best Results: 2020 Presidential Election Interactive Map This would come from the Democrats uniting behind him and his own moderation being just enough to win a handful of states that may have enough moderate Republicans that are dissatisfied enough to go against Trump. Trump’s Best Results: 2020 Presidential Election Interactive Map This would reflect the partisanship and the fact that A) the economy isn’t tanking and B) the odds are good that the progressives enough would rather suffer under Trump than have Biden. Most Realistic Results: 2020 Presidential Election Interactive Map This will represent a combination of factors. Biden may well win some Republican votes, and that will help flip a state like Michigan, which only just leans to the Left… but the economy is stable enough that Trump will have enough to win, if only narrowly.

He definitely can. In 2016, the people that voted for Trump, didn’t realize what a disaster he would be. Now, nobody’s on the fence about Trump, and even lifelong Republicans are voting for Biden to get rid of him. After his failure on COVID-19, I don’t know why anyone in their right mind would vote for him again. With the electoral college, the only states that really matter are Florida, Michigan, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin, Minnesota, and Ohio. Arizona has been a red state for decades and not only did Senator Sinema (D) beat McSally, but Mark Kelly (D) is polling ahead of McSally and beating her by a landslide in fundraising. I wouldn’t be surprised if Arizona went blue in November. The Democrats always do better when voter turnout is high, and voter turnout has been significantly higher in the midterms and the Democratic primary than previous years, even with the COVID-19 pandemic. Biden has 45 years of experience in government and Trump hasn’t learned a thing since taking office. He spends every single day rage-tweeting and watching Fox News when he’s not on a taxpayer-funded golf vacation. Clinton was unpopular and she beat Trump by 3 million votes with low voter turnout. Biden is doing far better in all of the primary states than Clinton did in 2016. Moderate Republicans used to make up a majority of the GOP base. An overwhelming majority of them are so tired of Trump that they would vote for a coma patient if it meant getting rid of Trump.

Yes, although it depends on your definition of a landslide. I’ll go through a few scenarios. Scenario 1- “Modest” Landslide  This is actually the current polling map but for a few exceptions. Biden carries Texas and Iowa in this scenario, netting him an additional 44 electoral votes. Although this scenario is unlikely if Trump manages to improve during the fall, it is still possible at least for now. Scenario 2- Not so Modest Landslide  This electoral map starts to become more ridiculous and lopsided as Biden picks up South Carolina, Indiana, Missouri, and Alaska. All three of the states currently show Biden behind 8–11 points. Basically Biden would have to improve around 5–6% in order to carry these states. Scenario 3- Sea of Blue  This map gives Biden the states of Montana, Kansas, Louisiana, and Mississippi. At this point the map isn’t even close to realistic. Scenario 4- 46-State Sweep  This would be nearly impossible, but the states of Oklahoma, West Virginia, Wyoming, and Idaho would still not flip. These states are so solid that they would resist a large landslide, although they might be close. Overall, all of the situations except for the first one are nearly impossible. The first situation resembles the current polling, except for a few additional states.

upvoters.user_id: Justin Mishina 三品 亮司

response.answer_text: Yes. The Trumpkin posters talk a lot about the 2016 polls, which were only off by about 1 point nationwide but ignored the distribution by state. (Almost no one was polling Wisconsin and Michigan.) But for some reason, they say nothing about the 2018 midterm election: you know, the one where Democratic House candidates outran Republicans by about 8½ points (modern record), and won 40 seats. Maybe the news hasn’t reached Moscow yet. If Biden runs 4 points ahead of Clinton (that is, a little behind the Democratic House candidates), he picks up MI, WI, PA, FL, NC, and AZ. Whether this is a landslide is in the eye of the beholder. I would say yes. It’s a larger margin of victory than 2016. Biden is tied or ahead in current polling in all these states, sometimes by substantial margins. Trump is also at risk of losing states he won comfortably in 2016 (Iowa, Georgia). Biden is not at risk in any Clinton state. You can judge the Republican desperation by the Governor of Georgia’s plan to salvage the state for the Republicans by prohibiting mask ordinances. COVID-19 kills black and brown voters at a higher rate, and the Republicans appear to hope the Grim Reaper will whiten up the Georgia electorate enough to salvage Trump and two Senate seats.

Biden’s win could be pretty big. He is currently expanding his support. If the election were held today and Biden won all the states he either has a less than 4.3% lead or trails by one or two percentage points, he’ll win 374 - 164 in the electoral college. Biden will still win if he loses all those states where his lead is 4.3% or less. Trump needs something really big to turn it around, and voters in this election are not moving the way they have in other elections after major events. We saw neither candidate get the usual convention bump, the Russian bounties on U.S. soldiers or Trump calling them “suckers” and “losers” did not cause large shifts, and neither did the debate. Despite lots of flailing about and the usual barrage of childish insults, Trump can’t put a dent in Biden’s favorability numbers. All Trump has been able to do is regain and probably solidify a lead in Texas and creep closer in Florida, where he trails by 2. To win, Trump is probably going to have to take Michigan and Wisconsin, where Biden has leads of 5.2 and 5.5% respectively. Biden has pretty much iced Pennsylvania, cutting off a major path for Trump.

I can’t speak directly to the math… My first inclination was to say no… that a landslide would be impossible against an incumbent, even one as polarizing as Trump. Then I thought for a moment… His strength includes an appeal to the Rust Belt. Trump won those against a weak opponent by a very few thousands. He’s polling poorly there now. All of these could go to him. Ohio, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and Michigan. Florida always seems to be close. Perhaps he’ll be on the winning side… And Here’s the longshot, but the question was *can* Joe Biden win in a landslide… Texas. Especially if he has a running mate that fits (think Beto or Castro) and energizes the Latino vote, polls are showing Texas is close to “in play”. It’s a tough road, and he’s not guaranteed the Democratic nomination, let alone a winning campaign against Trump, but *can* he? Actually, yeah. That’d be in the range of 360’s–170’s. That’s a landslide.

It’s possible but unlikely. Biden has to try and win over key battleground states first such as the three that lost Clinton the election: Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. Biden has quite a good chance in a few states that have generally been Republican but, in recent years, have been sliding over to the Democrats, such as North Carolina and Arizona. There’s a slight chance of Texas flipping as well, which would be intriguing to see. I don’t think a 100% electoral college is possible, though. Wyoming is a stronghold Republican state, and even Biden spending the entire campaign season there probably wouldn’t win him Wyoming (which is a terrible idea, but I doubt Biden would ever step foot in Wyoming this year). There are also few other staunch conservative states in that area that would be very reluctant to vote for a Democrat.

Not in an ACTUAL voting landslide, no. But as far as a “landslide” in comparison to Expectations? Yes. Both can. At best, Biden could “whip” Trump quite handily. But in the end, no, that wouldn’t be an actual voting landslide. Biden would carry what Hillary carried — including the super-close states that Hillary fell short on (Wisconsin, Michigan, Penn, Florida) — as well as flipping Arizona & North Carolina. And possibly Texas or Georgia — and if he did that with Texas, then you get into landslide territory. But certainly don’t count on all that - lol. It’s HIGHLY likely going to be a nail-biter. Especially since so many mail-in vote results are going to make Trump at first LOOK like he carried some borderline states AND former blue-leaning states — but then mail-in votes will flip many back. So don’t expect final results on Tuesday night or early Wed morning the next day. Expect it to take weeks. :)

There’s not gonna be a landslide for anyone — and least 40 states (probably closer to 45) are already locked in one way or the other. I think the electoral map favors Biden (or any Democrat). For Trump to win, he’d first have to win Florida, which is always a challenge for any candidate on either side. Then he must do well again in Wisconsin, Michigan and Pennsylvania, all of which ordinarily would be relatively easy wins for a Democrat, but all of which went to Trump in 2016 (albeit by an eyelash in each case). It’s all a matter of whether Trump can win those states again, this time running on his (debatable) record and merits, not simply because he’s facing Hillary Clinton, who was an extraordinarily bad candidate that much of the working class found repulsive. But Trump’s real support is difficult to poll with confidence, so it’s really hard to say.

The popular vote probably won't be a landslide in this or any election for the foreseeable future. The electorate is too polarized. For a landslide, you really have to have voters crossing party lines in some fairly significant numbers and that just isn't happening any time soon. That being said, there could be an Electoral College landslide. If Biden wins all 20 of the states Hillary won in 2016 (which seems likely), then that's 232 electoral votes. Picking up Pennsylvania, where Biden was born and remains very popular, gets him to 252. Michigan and Wisconsin are well within his grasp, especially if he picks Amy Klobuchar or Gretchen Whitmer as his running mate. That's 26 votes between then. That's 278 and the win before we even look at Florida or Ohio or North Carolina or Arizona. All of which are potential wins for Biden as well, to varying degrees of likelihood.

The question should be “can trump lose in a landslide “. This election has 0 to do with biden. People are voting for trump or against trump, Look at the red states that biden is polling even or better than trump. Do you really believe that they have become more liberal overnight? Look at Georgia, where I'm from, biden may turn it blue, not because we magically became liberal, it's because of trump. He's that bad of a candidate. Liberals and conservativesee seem to agree on one thing TRUMP HAS TO GO.

He could, if he is the nominee. Every day with Trump brings some new horror and/or idiocy. It is becoming ever more obvious that he doesn’t know what he is doing. If the economy starts showing cracks, he will lose his ace card. His personal behavior is so bad that whole swathes of voters, such as suburban women who turn out at high rates, are completely turned off by him. Plus, he gets along so poorly with others that he can only keep people with him like Kellyanne, who is odious. So, if Joe is the nominee and keeps on an even keel, yes, he could win in a landslide. But so could some other Democrat. It is not Joe or bust.

As others have pointed out, we’re too polarized at this point for anyone to win in a landslide, by any reasonable definition of the word. A good portion of the people voting are going to vote the way they do just because they’re Team Red or Team Blue. Having said that, I think Trump did a lot (especially since the pandemic started) to move people toward Team Blue. I don’t expect a landslide, but I expect an unambiguous victory for Biden where the Electoral College and popular vote agree. I don’t think anyone’s going to be counting hanging chads on election night.

Not after all the Liberal/Dem supporters have burned down their cities and voting sites in protests while the more rural area Republican/Conservative are sitting back and waiting for November to get a new little red hat with a new slogan after the Trump landslide win… Disclaimer….I’m disabling my comments because I’m tired of having to explain to people that the infamous polls are media driven and will always reflect what they want you to believe. No U-haul trucks will be pulling up to the White House this year.

It is now July 18, 2020. In three Polls last week, Biden was a whopping 3 points behind Trump, 2 points behind Trump and 1 point ahead of Trump respectively. All poll results were very much in the margin of error. What’s a little surprising is that these polls were for Georgia, Texas and North Carolina respectively. (Nationally Biden is 10–15 points ahead). That should answer your question if the election were held today. Of course, things could change in 4 months. Comey could come out a second time to say Biden’s emails are sitting on the server of an exhibitionist.

He could, given Trump’s overall unpopularity. However, Trump has a very loyal base and they will show up at the polls. And if Biden runs like he believes he will win in a landslide he will exude hubris and give his supporters a feeling they will win no matter what, and he will lose much like Hillary did. Biden had better run his election like he’s three points behind or I can guarantee he will lose.

Absolutely, I'm counting on it. Consider, first: Trump is really unpopular in the most important 2020 battleground states And then there is this: Biden leads Trump by 'landslide proportions' in new national poll Granted, there is much time between now and Election Day. However, based on the absolutely brutal speech Vice President Biden offered today in Iowa, I think it's clear that he has what it takes to hammer Trump every single day and also simultaneously remind us as Americans about the national unity we are capable of.

God help us if he does, but I highly doubt that that is going to happen. He has no platform, no plan, no substance. He offers no promises, especially for the direction of the country. His VP candidate is a crapshoot. She or he may have a lot more power than Joe, and Democrats are grooming this person as we speak. The choices so far are marginal and of no threat to Trump. Either way it is going to get ugly.

Sure, but I’d bet today on him losing in a landslide. That could change. It’s possible that the economy will tank or that the virus of the year kills off a lot of people and that voters accept the media’s excessive hype that it’s Trump’s fault. I’d like to believe most voters are smarter than the media but…

Can Biden lose in a landslide in 2020? Yes. Probably will. You can almost never win against a popular incumbent, who has the support of his party voters. When has that ever happened? Then there is Joe, no accomplishments in 40 years, trouble with hands-on-women when-not-wanted, corruption scandals coming, and oh, he doesn't know what day it is or where he is, or what his positions are, or used to be…

I would say since the 2000 election debacle, it is not possible for either nominee to win in a landslide in the next election or in the near future. Since the Republican takeover of Congress in 1994, American politics has gotten a lot more partisan, so the possibility of a landslide in the near future by either party is zero. America is a 45–45 nation.

Define “landslide.” Can he win the Electoral college by a comfortable margin? Yes. Can he win 49 states as Nixon and Reagan once did? Not a chance. No solidly red state will switch to Biden. But several swing states Trump grabbed last time could.

Can Joe Biden win in a landslide in 2020? If he runs the better ground game in key Electoral College swing states, he will likely win the election. He will almost surely win the national popular vote for what that’s worth. He is unlikely to win a landslide in either the popular vote of the Electoral college.
No, it is more likely that Trump will beat him in a landslide. The Democratic governor’s overreach on the shut down in their states will come back to bite them and Biden in November.

yes when trump has tried to devide us defraud us and engage in horrible crimes against the peole we have risen above him no state is out of reach for biden which is why I predict at least a 300 point electoral colage victory

Slow Joe is barely going to know what is happening to him jn November. I suspect Jill will tell him that the White House is being remodeled and his room at Trembling Acres nursing home is really the East Wing.

I doubt it will be a landslide. He may well win the popular vote but lose the Electoral College. The Sexual allegations against Biden are deeply worrying. Biden should do the lie detector test. These allegations are not going to go away.
He has a chance to win, but no way it’s a landslide. But I have confidence Joe can put his foot in his mouth several hundred times by November.
Only in the mountains if he pulls the rocks down on top of him…but THAT would be more like LOSING in a landslide, not that he isn’t perfectly capable of doing that. He is an idiot, after all.

He will be beaten like a drum, as he should. He's not a leader and never will be one. His whole adult life has been devoted to enriching himself and his family through graft, kickbacks, corruption, and influence peddling.
No chance in hell. Does joe even know what office he is even running for?
Conceivably, but don’t sell Putin short. I’m sure he still has plenty of tricks up his sleeve. And there will still be plenty of voter suppression. The virus will be an excuse to do even more.
He will likely win the nomination. He will likely loose the general.
No he can not win.

Winning by 10% has been the standard for being a landslide and Biden could do that. Historically the undecideds have usually broken heavily (75% or even 80%) for the challenger at the end. If that happens this time Biden could win in a landslide.
Biden will not even be the nominee. The fact that he is an idiot and a pedophile will eventually come out.
Only if Trump is mountain climbing where the landslide occurred
Nope. In fact, it is possible that he will lose. And I certainly hope that he will lose.

If he is the nominee, and he would be a good one, he WILL win.

Yes! And he will! Honesty and experience is what is desperately needed in our poor country. Joe is the one to right the ship! YES!
Gosh maybe not in a landslide victry ..but OMG I really really really hope and pray that he wins !!!! America needs him so extremely bad
He can’t win at all without a massive landslide big enough to flood out all the Republican election rigging.
A lot with depend on the unemployment rate and Covid-19 and if there is a second wave. Or rather when there is a second wave come flue season around October.
